home.about.title: Why we built InterviewPilot AI
home.about.body:
Interview quality often depends too much on the individual interviewer.
InterviewPilot AI helps teams run structured, fair, and repeatable interviews by generating role-specific questions and scorecards.
This project showcases how I think about product design, AI prompting, and end-to-end experience for hiring teams.
role.heading: Paste the Job Description

role.title.label: Role Title (optional)
role.level.label: Experience Level
role.sample.confirmOverwrite: Replace the current text with a sample job description?
role.tips.leadingText: For the best results, paste the actual job description from your ATS or job board.
role.tips.title: Tips for better AI output
role.tips.point1: Include the most important responsibilities and what success looks like in the first 6–12 months.
role.tips.point2: List must-have skills separately from nice-to-have skills.
role.tips.point3: Avoid internal-only jargon that an external candidate would not understand.
candidate.heading: Paste the Candidate Resume or Summary
candidate.subheading: This step is optional. Adding candidate information helps personalize the interview questions.
candidate.placeholder: Paste candidate resume, LinkedIn summary, or key highlights here...
candidate.sample.confirmOverwrite: Replace the current text with a sample candidate profile?
candidate.tips.leadingText: Optional, but helps InterviewPilot tailor follow-up questions to the candidate.
candidate.tips.title: What works well here
candidate.tips.point1: Summarize key projects and outcomes rather than listing every job.
candidate.tips.point2: Call out specific technologies, domains, and team sizes.
candidate.tips.point3: Mention 2–3 examples that show ownership, problem solving, and collaboration.
